treasury_media.title: Recordopbrengst Nederlandse wijndruiven in 2022
treasury_media.description:
Nederlandse Wijninfo | VNWP

De Nederlandse wijnboeren hebben in 2022 een recordhoeveelheid druiven geoogst. Dat blijkt uit de oogstcijfers die de Rijksdienst voor Ondernemend Nederland (RVO) heeft gepubliceerd. In totaal is er 9.837 hectoliter wijn geproduceerd. Dat is zo’n dertig procent meer dan een jaar eerder.

treasury_media.title: Nederlandse wijnbouw groeit door kennis, klimaat en nieuwe rassen
treasury_media.description:
Nieuwe Oogst.

Nederlandse wijnbouw groeit door kennis, klimaat en nieuwe rassen

Zuid-Europese druiventelers kampen al voor het derde jaar met misoogsten door extreme droogte. Daarentegen lijkt de Nederlandse druiventeelt door de warmere klimaatomstandigheden juist een beloftevolle toekomst tegemoet te gaan. Maar volgens de Vereniging van Nederlandse Wijnboeren moeten we ons niet te snel rijk rekenen.

treasury_media.title: Nederlandse wijn scoort goed bij kenners
treasury_media.description:
Nieuwe Oogst.

Nederlandse wijn scoort goed bij kenners

In Nederland zijn er ongeveer 170 wijnproducenten die op 250 hectare wijndruiven telen. De totale productie aan wijn in ons land komt dit jaar op zo'n 900.000 liter. Nederlandse wijn wordt internationaal gewaardeerd vanwege de duurzame teelt en goede smaak.

treasury_media.title: Nieuwe Oogst | Nederlandse wijnproductie daalt licht in 2021
treasury_media.description:
Nieuwe Oogst.

Nederlandse wijnproductie daalt licht in 2021

De Nederlandse wijnboeren produceerden vorig jaar 7.529 hectoliter wijn. Dat is een lichte daling vergeleken met een jaar eerder.

treasury_media.title: Statistics Netherlands (CBS) | Slight rise in Dutch wine production
treasury_media.description:
Statistics Netherlands (CBS).

In 2017, the Netherlands had 92 vineyards, four more than in the previous year. The total vineyard surface area increased slightly to 157 hectares. The province of Limburg is the leading producer of wine grapes, as shown by the latest regional agricultural figures released by Statistics Netherlands (CBS).

treasury_media.title: LTO Nederland | Toekomstvisie 2030 - LTO
treasury_media.description:
LTO Nederland

Toekomstvisie 2030

LTO Nederland presenteert met de Toekomstvisie 2030 een positief manifest gericht op goed eten, mooi groen en sterk ondernemerschap. Drie thema’s waar LTO Nederland richting de toekomst op inzet. Het is een concept-visie, geschreven op basis van intensieve gesprekken met duizenden leden.

treasury_media.title: BGCI Year in Review | BGCi | Botanic Gardens Conservation International
treasury_media.description:
BGCI Year in Review.

Welcome to BGCI’s new look Year in Review which, as we look back at 2021, replaces the Member’s Review format of the past five years. Feedback we received from our recent member’s survey suggested that a more user-friendly, news-based format would be welcome, and that is what we have tried to provide. Another important difference is that we aim to give you, our members, much more of a voice. In this spirit, we would welcome any feedback on the new format and its contents.

Associated resources:

2021 Year in Review

ABOUT BGCI / PUBLICATION / ENGLISH

BGCI highlights its work to save plants, inspire people, share knowledge and resources, and address global challenges in its 2021 Year in Review.

treasury_media.title: Global Center on Adaptation | State and Trends in Adaptation Report 2021
treasury_media.description:
Global Center on Adaptation. 2021. 

State and Trends in Adaptation Report 2021: Africa

How Adaptation Can Make Africa Safer, Greener and More Prosperous in a Warming World

State and Trends in Adaptation 2021 combines in-depth analyses, case studies, and viewpoints from those on the frontlines of climate change impacts in Africa. It presents a detailed blueprint for action: offering innovative adaptation and resilience ideas, solutions, and policy recommendations. The results are clear and compelling. Adaptation measures can be enormously cost effective and have the potential to start a positively reinforcing cycle of benefits. As these measures protect people and communities from floods, droughts, and others impacts, they also help lift people out of poverty, reduce hunger and undernourishment, raise incomes and living standards, fight diseases, create jobs, reduce inequality, mitigate the risk of conflicts, and give voice to the most vulnerable. These realizable results, in turn, further increase resilience to climate impacts.

Founder, Owner, Managing Director, Wine Consultant, Wine Scout, Wine Reviewer at WINETASTERY®

Exclusive sales, marketing, distribution, import, export of wines, sparkling wines and spirits (also biodynamic, organic, natural and sustainable). Agency/Agenture for wine and champagne houses / producers.
profile_positions.title: Founder, Managing Director, Wine Consultant, Wine Scout, Wine Reviewer

profile_positions.description:
Member

Company member (Winetastery)

The Porto Protocol Foundation is an international non-profit institution, founded by Taylor Fladgate Port, with hundreds of other members committed to make a greater contribution to mitigate climate change.

Born in the wine industry and spread across the whole value chain, we strive to be a catalyst of climate action. Our belief is that, if we share our successes and experiences, our response to climate change will be more effective.

We are a community of practice, an open platform, a dynamic database of resources and workable solutions, a place of inspiration for change and collaborative sharing.

Porto Protocol has been awarded with the prize for best Green Initiative by the The Drinks Magazine Green Awards 2020.

Visit and join: www.portoprotocol.com
profile_positions.title: Lid

company.name: The Australian Society of Viticulture & Oenology (ASVO)

profile_positions.description:
Wine Judge, Member

ASVO

The Australian Society of Viticulture and Oenology was founded in 1980 as a non-political organisation to serve the interests of practicing winemakers and viticulturists by encouraging the exchange of technical information.

The Society has held over 40 one-day seminars since it was established and, in conjunction with The Australian Wine Research Institute, organises the Australian Wine Industry Technical Conference every three years.

The Society has awarded over 20 scholarships for research and international study visits.

Our membership now exceeds 700 individuals and affiliated companies.

www.asvo.com.au
profile_positions.title: Wine Judge

company.name: American Society for Enology and Viticulture

profile_positions.company: American Society for Enology and Viticulture
profile_positions.description:
Member

The American Society for Enology and Viticulture (the sciences of winemaking and grape growing) is a 501 (c)(6), tax exempt professional society dedicated to the interests of enologists, viticulturists, and others in the fields of wine and grape research and production throughout the world. Our membership includes professionals from wineries, vineyards, academic institutions and organizations.
Formed in 1950, and originally composed of researchers from the University of California and California winemakers, the ASEV has held a steady growth over the years. We currently have 1500 members, 100 Industrial Affiliates (companies), and two chapters: an Eastern U.S. Chapter and the ASEV Japan Chapter.

www.asev.org

profile_positions.description:
Member

SASEV (South African Society For Enology & Viticulture) serves as a forum for presenting the latest technical and scientific information to all South African wine and grape producers to improve the quality of South African table grapes, raisin grapes, wines and related products.

www.sasev.org

profile_positions.description:
Online Volunteer to transcribe Herbarium Specimens.

Transcribing the information you see on specimen labels, help Kew, online, to make specimens available online to the whole world. In doing so, helping Kew and others answer scientific questions about a variety of charismatic plant genera, e.g. where have they been found and how long ago. How much variation is there within species, depending on where it grows. Find gaps in the Kew collections.

www.kew.org

GLFx Member at the GLFx platform for the Global Landscapes Forum.

GLFx is the new digital platform for the Global Landscapes Forum community. GLFx is dedicated to passionate people who are working to accelerate action towards more sustainable, integrated landscape management. GLFx is designed to enable and empower community members with the connections, knowledge and technology to connect, share, learn and act online and in person. From hosting events in your landscape, town or city to joining online communities of practice.

#ThinkLandscape 

https://glfx.globallandscapesforum.org

GLF Social Media Ambassador 2021 at Global Landscapes Forum (GLF).

The GLF Social Media Ambassadors Program (SMAP) 2021 aims to connect, and empower motivated young leaders who want to spark the conversation around sustainable landscapes. This is a diverse, multicultural, and inclusive network.

GLF. World’s largest knowledge-led platform on sustainable land use. Connect, share, learn act.

#ThinkLandscape #GLFBiodiversity

www.globallandscapesforum.org
